isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - CHARGE AIR COOLER, REPLACE

wtsproc.config: Vehicle is equipped with air conditioning.

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Perform partial drain of cooling system.
Remove both charge air cooler pipes/hoses.
Remove upper radiator hose from radiator and engine.
Disconnect air conditioning condenser lines/hoses from radiator frame and fan shroud (if applicable).

note.para: Do not open air conditioning system.

step1.para: Remove air recirculation seal/plate from top of radiator assembly.
Obtain suitable device to support hood. Disconnect hood support cables and shock absorber from radiator assembly. Lay hood on support (2 people).
Remove cable/shock absorber mount bracket from left side of radiator assembly.
Remove air recirculation seal/plate from left side of radiator assembly.
Remove air conditioning condenser with right side air recirculation seal/plate from radiator assembly. Secure out of way for access (if applicable).
Remove transmission oil cooler from radiator assembly. Lay cooler in grille area of hood.
Remove bolts retaining charge air cooler. Remove charge air cooler (2 people).
Install charge air cooler (2 people).
Install transmission oil cooler to radiator assembly.
Install air conditioning condenser with right side air recirculation seal/plate to radiator assembly (if applicable).
Install cable/shock absorber mount bracket to radiator assembly.
Connect hood support cables and shock absorber to radiator assembly (2 people).
Install air recirculation seal/plate to top of radiator assembly.
Connect air conditioning condenser lines/hoses to radiator frame and fan shroud (if applicable).
Install upper radiator hose to radiator and engine.
Install both charge air cooler pipes/hoses.
Fill cooling system.

note.para: Open drain valve on upper radiator pipe (hose) to bleed air out of cooling system. Close valve when coolant appears at valve opening.

step1.para: Start engine and check for leaks. Fill as needed to obtain proper coolant level.
Remove wheel chocks.
